text: Not to be overly competitive, is it safe to wager that idiomatically written julia code is almost always faster than corresponding R code?

elements.text: Not to be overly competitive, is it safe to wager that idiomatically written julia code is almost always faster than corresponding R code?

text: As a user of R+Julia both, I would say in a lot of cases yes. When I write the code in a similar way to R (and using the broadcasting .) I often still get big speedups. Especially when it comes to anything involving simulations or parallel computing. Actually in some cases Julia w/o parallel comp also has been comparable to R with `doParallel` and `foreach` . That said, `data.table` in R currently is still the fastest and beats Julia `DataFrames` because it is multithreaded.
